intro: Geocardia pleuropoda, commonly known as the pleuropodous geocardia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Cistaceae. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant that thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow or white flowers. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. Due to its unique adaptations, it is often found in crevices and on rocky outcrops where it can retain moisture.
